job.title: Software Development Engineer - Automation (R3924)
job.description:
Description
Avalara, Inc., (www.Avalara.com), is the leading provider of cloud-based software that delivers a broad array of compliance solutions related to sales tax and other transactional taxes.
What is it like to work at Avalara? Come find out! We are committed to the following success traits that embody our culture and how we work together to accomplish great things: Fun. Passion. Adaptability. Urgency. Simplicity. Curiosity. Humility. Ownership. Optimism.
We are building cloud-based tax compliance solutions to handle every transaction in the world. Imagine every transaction you make - every tank of gas, cup of coffee, or pair of sneakers, every movie ticket, or streamed song, every sensor-to-sensor ping. Nearly every time you make a purchase, physical or digital, there is an accompanying unique and nuanced tax compliance calculation.
We are seeking a highly motivated, experienced
Software Development Engineer - Automation
to join our team.
About The Role
AvaTech is looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer who has a primary focus on Automation and scalable processes in Corporate Information Technology. The ideal candidate will have experience automating complex workflows and tasks across a variety of systems including integrations with Okta, Active Directory, ServiceNow, and Workday. Automation of Avlarian's integrated systems and design through an employee's lifecycle at Avalara will be the primary focus on this position. You will apply design thinking and next-gen technologies to solve business challenges. You'll work side-by-side with various architecture, managers, engineers, and consultants to build innovative solutions to solve business challenges.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with a diverse set of business customers and technology professionals
Use analytical and problem-solving skills to design efficient and robust automation logic
Ability to help architect end-to-end RPA solutions
Participate in designing Automation scenarios and workflows
Design, code, configure and test automation logic
Prepare test scenarios and perform unit tests
Work closely across all of Avalara to design integrated workflows and processes
Leverage knowledge of continuous improvement methods
Operate within the agile delivery and continuous improvement methodologies
Ability to understand and utilize common APIs
Build Custom code for integrations throughout a wide range of modern technologies
Self-starting with the ability to manage multiple automation initiatives in parallel
The applicant must have strong communication, customer service, troubleshooting, and organizational skills, and the ability to complete assigned work
Ability to identify and apply best practices, standards, and SDLC concepts to all functional areas
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology or related field
12+ years of programming/systems development experience
8 years of relevant experience with emphasis in process automation development
5+ years of experience working development; participation & support for UAT/Other testing phases, and support release management to environments
Advanced knowledge of APIs, Okta, Powershell
Automation as a primary focus to scale out Avalara networks
Excellent leadership and mentoring skills
High level problem-solving and communication skills
About Avalara
Avalara helps businesses of all sizes achieve compliance with transactional taxes, including VAT, sales and use, excise, communications, and other tax types. We deliver comprehensive, automated, cloud-based solutions that are fast, accurate, and easy to use.
Avalara offers hundreds of pre-built connectors into leading accounting, ERP, ecommerce and other business applications. Each year, the company processes billions of tax transactions for customers and users, files hundreds of thousands of tax compliance documents and tax returns and manages millions of exemption certificates and other compliance related documents.
Avalara’s headquarters are in Seattle, WA and it has offices across the U.S. and in Brighton and London, England; Brussels, Belgium; and Pune, India. More information at: www.avalara.com
